reflexive.name: multitex overlay
reflexive.comment: where you want the origin of the texture. *"texture" uses the texture coordinates supplied *"screen" uses the origin of the screen as the origin of the texture
how to blend the textures together
how much to scale the textures
how much to offset the origin of the texture
which maps to use

reflexive.name: effectors
reflexive.comment: These describe the relationship that causes the effect. * destination type is the type of variable you want to be effected * destination tells which texture map (or geometry offset) to apply it to * source says which value to look at when computing the effect
When the source is at the lower inbound, the destination ends up the lower outbound and vice-versa applies for the upper values.
If destination is tint, these values are used instead of the out bounds.
If you use a periodic function as the source, this lets you tweak it.

If you use a periodic function as the source, this lets you tweak it.

bit.name: interpolate between min/max flash colors as state changes

int16.name: value scale
int16.description: used for non-integral values, i.e. health and shields
